ai.summary: Leland Trail is a 10.4 km moderate hike in the UK. The route offers varied terrain and a steady pace, suitable for hikers with some experience and a moderate fitness level.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail features a mix of well-maintained footpaths, grassy meadow sections, and occasional uneven or rocky patches. Expect gentle ascents and descents, with potential mud after rain and short stream crossings. Footing can be variable, so footwear with good grip is recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather and daylight hours before setting out. Stay on the marked path, watch for slippery or uneven surfaces, and be prepared for sudden changes in conditions. Carry a map/compass or offline GPS, keep an emergency contact informed of your plans, and bring sufficient water and snacks. If visibility or footing is poor, consider turning back or shortening the route.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or offline GPS
Fully charged phone with emergency battery
Lightweight rain gear and sun protection
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late return)
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (April-September) are typically best for the Leland Trail in the UK. Winter and very wet conditions can make the path muddier and daylight shorter.

seo.title: Leland Trail – 10.4 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Leland Trail: a 10.4 km moderate hike in the UK with varied terrain, practical safety tips, and gear recommendations for a enjoyable day trip.
